title: Nipah virus infection
summary: A Nipah virus infection is a viral infection caused by the Nipah virus.[2] Symptoms from infection vary from none to fever, cough, headache, shortness of breath, and confusion.[1][2] This may worsen into a coma over a day or two,[1] and 50 to 75% of those infected die. Complications can include inflammation of the brain and seizures following recovery.[2]
